intro: Bulbostylis subaphylla, commonly known as the narrow-leaved bulbostylis, is a small herbaceous plant native to tropical regions of Africa. It belongs to the grass family (Poaceae) and is characterized by its compact, clump-forming growth habit. The plant features slender, grass-like leaves and produces small, inconspicuous flowers that are typically arranged in dense clusters. It thrives in moist, well-drained soils and is often found in wetlands or along riverbanks. Due to its limited distribution and specific habitat requirements, it is considered a rare and endangered species in many parts of its range.
